intro: Senecio larecajensis, commonly known as the Larecajá Senecio, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ecuador. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, displaying small, yellowish to greenish flowers. It has finely divided leaves and is often found in alpine meadows at elevations above 3,000 meters. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
